EditInstructions.en-us: Create a custom list of values to pick from, optionally with a different label.

Label.en-us: UI Picker Source - Custom List of Values

Notes.en-us: Just a name so you can identify this picker source if you ever want to re-use it.

DefaultValue.en-us:
Value without extra label
l:Left (will store an l)
r:Right (will store an r)
c:Center (... c)
m:Middle
27:Twenty Seven
random:Random value
MIT:MIT License

Notes.en-us: Type in the values, one per line and separate values and labels with a ":".- see docs.

For custom lists such as this one, the placeholders you can use are limited to the following:

  • [Item:Value]
  • [Item:Title]
A title for you to identify this configuration in case you want to reuse it.
One or more Content-Types to retrieve from the backend.
The field of the items which will be stored as a value.
The field which will be shown in the dropdown as the visible field for the user to select.
Additional fields can be used for tooltip, help or information.

Description.en-us: Will get the attributes for an Entity Picker.
Will get the attributes for an Entity Picker.
Will get the attributes for an Entity Picker.

EditInstructions.en-us: Configure what query to use to get values to pick from.

Notes.en-us: A title to identify this configuration, in case you want to reuse it.
Pick the query which would be used to prepare the items a user can select. For very advanced scenarios you can also manually enter a special query.

Name.en-us: More Settings eg. Different Value or Label

Notes.en-us: The Out-stream name on the query, usually "Default"
The field of the items which will be stored as a value.
The field which will be shown in the dropdown as the visible field for the user to select.
Additional fields can be used for tooltip, help or information.

EditInstructions.en-us:
Configure a Item (Entity) Picker. This is a new concept which is still in BETA ⚠️, so it may still change a bit. 

The core idea is that you separate the UI (this configuration) from the Source Definition (see Source below). The Source can be reused in other pickers, and it allows many more features then were possible before.

Csv.en-us:
Value,Title,Info,Disabled
list,"Default","Dropdown with search and dialog when more need to be selected.",false

auto-inline,"Inline Auto WIP","Inline - automatically showing checkboxes or radio buttons, depending on the amount of items you can select",true
radio,"Inline Radio Buttons WIP","Inline radio button selection for single-item choices",true
checkbox,"Inline Checkboxes WIP","Inline checkbox list for multiple item selection",true

tree,"Tree structure - requires more configuration (BETA, doesn't work yet)",,true

Description.en-us: Get all Data Sources for UI Pickers.

Description.en-us: Get all Data Sources for UI Pickers.

Notes.en-us: A title for this configuration, in case you want to reuse it.

DropdownValues.en-us:
child-parent:Child has reference to Parent
parent-child:Parent has references to Children

Notes.en-us: Which stream in the source should be used for branches / folders. Most sources only have a Default.
Which stream in the source should be used for leaves / files / lost-levers. Most sources only have a Default.
The field on the parent which identifies it. Typically Id.
The field on the child which identifies it. Typically Id.
The field on the parent, which would contain references to the children (when using Parent-Child relationships).
The field on the child, which would contain a reference to the parent (when using Child-Parent relationships).
If the root node(s) should be shown. Set to false, if you only have 1 root and it's not meant to be used.
Maximum Tree depth incl. root and leaves. This is to avoid infinite recursions etc.
Allow selecting the root node. You may want to disable this, if the root is always an object which you don't want selected.
Allow selecting any branch node. You may want to disable this, if you only want file-selects, but not folder-selects.
Configure / Select DataSources for this Picker to provide choices.
* This activates editing functionality on an item - usually by showing a pencil-icon.
*This allows the user to create new items of the type(s) used in this list.
*Add Existing todo
*This allows the user to remove an item in the list.
*text entry

TitleTrue.en-us: enable free text entry by user ⌨️🔓

Notes.en-us: *Allow picking multiple items - otherwise the user can only pick 1 item.
*Enable the user to select the same item multiple times in the list.

TitleFalse.en-us: items can only be selected once 1️⃣

Notes.en-us: If you want to support selecting multiple items, you'll need something to keep them separate. We recommend a comma or new-line, but maybe you want something different.
Define a minimum amount of item which must be picked.
When allowing multiple, max amount to allow.
Choose how the picker should be presented.
How the picker should be displayed, ATM only for special tree configurations.
Configure advanced settings when creating / editing items in this list.
Prefill URL Parameters when creating a new item.
Form URL Parameters when creating a new item. Not for prefill, but to affect formulas which expect these parameters.
Form URL Parameters when editing a new item. Not for prefill, but to affect formulas which expect these parameters.

Get all Data Sources for UI Pickers.

Value,Title,Info,Disabled

Notes.en-us: Since this Data Source can be reused, it's helpful to provide a detailed description of what it does. This is optional.

Name.en-us: Description to help pick the right Data Source

Notes.en-us: This will be shown on the info-button when picking data-sources, to better find this one.
Specify one or more types - so the user can create new items.
Provide additional information to guide / help the user.
Show a rich tooltip on each item. You can use placeholders like [Item:FieldName].
Show information behind an ℹ️ icon on each item. You can use placeholders like [Item:FieldName].
Show a link to another page on each item. You can use placeholders like [Item:FieldName].
A simple name so you can identify this source when you re-use it.

⚠️ Warning ⚠️

You are configuring an new CSV source. It appears that this feature is not enabled. See Picker CSV Source feature docs.

✅ You can still use this source and everything will work, but it will show a warning that you're using an unlicensed feature.

Create a mini-table with CSV. Note that as of now, the configuration is as follows:

  1. the first row must contain the column names, and must contain a Value. The Title is not required, but recommended. 
  2. spaces will be trimmed, so <Value,Title> and <Value, Title> are the same
  3. empty lines will be skipped
  4. delimiter will be guessed, we suggest you use a comma ","
  5. if you have text containing the delimiter, best put it in quotes eg "I think, therefore I am"
  6. numbers are not parsed, so make sure you use the neutral "." format like 42.27

DefaultValue.en-us:
Value,Title,Info,Link
2sxc,2sxc CMS,the best plugin for Dnn and Oqtane,https://2sxc.org
2sic,2sic - makers of 2sxc,the creators of 2sxc,https://2sic.com
Descartes,René Descartes,"I think, therefore I am","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cogito,_ergo_sum"
